document.docAuthor: Almeida, Alexandre O., Terossi, Mariana, Buranelli, Raquel C., Castilho, Antonio L., Costa, Rogério C., Zara, Fernando J. & Mantelatto, Fernando L.
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapods (Crustacea) from the coast of São Paulo State (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: II. Infraorder Caridea: family Alpheidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapods (Crustacea) from the coast of São Paulo State (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: II. Infraorder Caridea: family Alpheidae

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Alpheus saulcyi var. brevicarpus
Herrick, 1891 : 384
(? part.); pl. 4, figs. 1–3; pl. 21, figs. 1–4, 8, 9; pl. 22, figs. 1, 2, 4–10, 12– 16; pl. 23, figs. 1–8; pl. 24, figs. 1, 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined. Brazil, São Paulo: our material was grouped into two different color patterns that we list below, with a third provisional group for those lacking data on color pattern.

Synalpheus cf. brevicarpus
(green/blue chela):
3 ind (1 ♀ov), CCDB 3419, Ubatuba, Enseada de Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, on
Schizoporella ,
coll. F. Mantelatto et al ., 22.ii.2011 ; 4 ind, CCDB 3420, Ubatuba, Enseada de Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, on
Schizoporella ,
coll. F. Mantelatto et al ., 22.ii.2011 ; 10 ind (2 ♀ov), CCDB 3834, Ubatuba, Enseada de Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, on
Schizoporella ,
coll. I. Leone et al ., 25.i.2012 ; 17 ind (7 ♀ov), CCDB 4857, Ubatuba, Enseada de Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, on
Schizoporella ,
16.x.2012 ; 1 ind, CCDB 4863, Ubatuba, Enseada de Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, on green sponges, coll. F. Zara & M. Terossi, 09.iv.2013 ; 1 ind, CCDB 5047, Ubatuba, Praia Itaguá, coll. M. Negri et al. , 11.ix.2013 ; 1 ind, CCDB 4836, Ubatuba, Ilha Vitória, 11.iv.2013 .

Distribution . Western Atlantic—Bermuda, USA ( Florida ), Bahamas , West Indies,
Panama
, Brazil ( Ceará to Rio Grande do Sul ) ( Christoffersen 1979 , 1998 ; Bezerra & Coelho 2006—all references as
S. brevicarpus
).

Remarks.
Synalpheus brevicarpus
is a transisthmian species complex which includes several undescribed species (
Almeida et al. 2012a
; Anker et al. 2012). We found two color patterns: a blue/green chelae and a pink/ orange chelae. Both patterns match the morphology of
S. brevicarpus
described by Herrick (1891) . In our analyses, we discriminated specimens with both patterns from those without any color information. This discrimination might be useful to facilitate the future recognition of our material after a taxonomic revision is accomplished. GenBank accession number: CCDB 3416 (blue/green)—16S ( KF667548 ).
